channel.title: How do i fix my player folder, check this out
channel.description: Im so sorry for being dumb but this is my first rsps. The character folder that i made works, it saves the data but its just a jumble of really weird text. Ill send a screenshot it looks like its encrypted or something btw the player folder does work like it saves the data for the account but I want to know how I can make myself owner with it. Heres a screenshot http://gyazo.com/f71208753d3a7eaa206e76e8b96484cf

item.title: How do i fix my player folder, check this out
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

OP, can you post your saving player and reading player methods?

Read full topic
item.source: How do i fix my player folder, check this out

item.title: How do i fix my player folder, check this out
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ggson, post:10, topic:547130”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666028.msg4452697#msg4452697 date=1412631979]
The characters are saved in a .dat format more than likely. Typically, you can’t read .dat files with text editors, as they come up with a bunch of weird shapes. But some data may be readable…

If you want to make it readable, you’re going to have to change the save format from a .dat to a .txt, which will require you to change most of the saving system.

Otherwise, you’ll have to find a way to add the code in to change/add the permissions you want.
[/quote]

Since when do people save player data in dat formats?

What your looking at is a form of binary saving. This basically encrypts the data into a ‘.bin’ file (unless you are using 718+ which people normally program Seriazable saving, which in some cases is much more efficient. There is no way you can edit the credentials in the encrypted file for security reasons, hence why the developers program Binary or Seriazable saving methods. So to make your self owner, you have to go to the method that loads the encrypted file (normally found in the player class) and add (if you have this method)

if (getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("Your name")) {
player.setRights(2);
}

If you have any other questions feel free to ask.[/quote]
Since when? I’ve seen plenty of servers…
I’d think they got the idea from how the cache is saved and etc. I haven’t seen any ‘.bin’ file used for player saves, ever. In the 700+ servers, they used .p files. Or that I’ve seen, it easily could have changed.
I didn’t really look into the 500-600 servers, but I believe they used xml.
317-377/474 people typically used .txt, but there are plenty of servers where they converted the system to that of a newer release, so like taking the system from a 525 that used xml. I see people implement their own systems too. I believe I saw player saving done by json recently…

OP any news on your issue?

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix my player folder, check this out
item.dc:creator: @ggson ggson
item.description:
@ggson wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:547130”]The characters are saved in a .dat format more than likely. Typically, you can’t read .dat files with text editors, as they come up with a bunch of weird shapes. But some data may be readable…

If you want to make it readable, you’re going to have to change the save format from a .dat to a .txt, which will require you to change most of the saving system.

Otherwise, you’ll have to find a way to add the code in to change/add the permissions you want.[/quote]

Since when do people save player data in dat formats?

What your looking at is a form of binary saving. This basically encrypts the data into a ‘.bin’ file (unless you are using 718+ which people normally program Seriazable saving, which in some cases is much more efficient. There is no way you can edit the credentials in the encrypted file for security reasons, hence why the developers program Binary or Seriazable saving methods. So to make your self owner, you have to go to the method that loads the encrypted file (normally found in the player class) and add (if you have this method)

if (getUsername().equalsIgnoreCase("Your name")) {
player.setRights(2);
}

If you have any other questions feel free to ask.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix my player folder, check this out
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

levyys:

ok so its telling me to paste some code into settings.java but were do i put the code in the file? at the end? sorry i’m really bad at this :L

That’d be why I said concept. Because not everything he has in his 718+ server will be in your 317 server.

Read full topic
item.source: How do i fix my player folder, check this out

item.title: How do i fix my player folder, check this out
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

levyys:

ok so its telling me to paste some code into settings.java but were do i put the code in the file? at the end? sorry i’m really bad at this :L

It really has nothing to do with Settings class.

Go to Player class, and search up for a method called “initialize”, “init” or something like this.

In 667+ it would look similar to this:

if(getUserName().equalsIgnoreCase("username"))
rights = 1;

In 317

if(c.username.equalsIgnoreCase("username"))
c.rights = 3;

Play a bit around, i’m sure you’re able to figure it out alone.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i fix my player folder, check this out
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“levyys, post:3, topic:547130”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=666028.msg4452697#msg4452697 date=1412631979]
The characters are saved in a .dat format more than likely. Typically, you can’t read .dat files with text editors, as they come up with a bunch of weird shapes. But some data may be readable…

If you want to make it readable, you’re going to have to change the save format from a .dat to a .txt, which will require you to change most of the saving system.

Otherwise, you’ll have to find a way to add the code in to change/add the permissions you want.
[/quote]
Hey thanks for helping me out I thought it had something to do with how the format that it was saved in, but how can I change it to .txt I just want to do it to my account because i want to give myself owner rights[/quote]
Or you could refer to the 10001 people that have made a “guide” for giving you owner rights on a 700+ server…
see this topic: https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=657559.0
He says how.

Read full topic
